    boolean automaticResourcesRequest​(Resource[] resources, boolean remove)
    If the remove parameter is set true it automatically removes the resources requested in the parameter by checking with each store.
    boolean basicProduction​(ResourceType input1, ResourceType input2, ResourceType output)
    Implements the behaviour of the basic production inside of the scroll: check the warehouse and strongbox (also the leader card depot if activated) for the input resources and, if those are present, remove them and add the output resource to the strongbox.
    boolean checkResourceRequirement​(Resource[] requirements)
    compare the requirements array to the sum of all the resources in every store and, if there is at least as much quantity of resources in the sum array as there is in the requirements array, returns true, false otherwise.

    • basicProduction

      public boolean basicProduction​(ResourceType input1, ResourceType input2, ResourceType output) throws IllegalFaithResourceInputException
      Implements the behaviour of the basic production inside of the scroll: check the warehouse and strongbox (also the leader card depot if activated) for the input resources and, if those are present, remove them and add the output resource to the strongbox.
      Parameters:
      input1 - is the first resource given as input.
      input2 - is the second resource given as input.
      output - is the resource requested as output.
      Returns:
      true if the input resources are present and removed and output resource is added, false if the input resources aren't present.
      Throws:
      IllegalFaithResourceInputException

    • automaticResourcesRequest

      public boolean automaticResourcesRequest​(Resource[] resources, boolean remove)
      If the remove parameter is set true it automatically removes the resources requested in the parameter by checking with each store. First it removes resources from the Warehouse, if anything is left it removes from the leader card depot, and at last it removes what's left in the parameter from the strongBox. Returns true if every resources was found in the stores, false otherwise. If the remove parameter is false the method only check if all the resources can be found in the stores and returns true if that's the case, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      resources - contains the array with the resources to be found in the stores.
      remove - if true indicates to remove the resources from the store, if false indicates only to check if those are present.
      Returns:
      true if all the resources were found, false otherwise.

    • checkResourceRequirement

      public boolean checkResourceRequirement​(Resource[] requirements)
      compare the requirements array to the sum of all the resources in every store and, if there is at least as much quantity of resources in the sum array as there is in the requirements array, returns true, false otherwise. If one of the arrays is null, returns false
      Parameters:
      requirements - is the array to compare
      Returns:
      true if there are enough resources in the stores to cover the requirements, false otherwise.

    • peekAllStoresResources

      public Resource[] peekAllStoresResources()
      Sums the resources from all stores and returns an array with the sums. If there are no resources, returns null.
      Returns:
      an array with all the resources from every store
